text:
Created attachment 24560
Patch to fix many of the non-private loggers.

Loggers are intialised with the class name, so it does not make sense to me to
allow them to be used by other classes, i.e. the logger should be private and
final.

Note that the ReceiverBase class had a setLog() method which I removed in order
to make the log final.
creator: sebb@apache.org
markt@apache.org
text:
Patch applied. Thanks.

Since removing the setLog() method didn't break anything, I don't see the harm. I'm sure Filip will shout if it is an issue.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Found a few more non-private loggers.

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
Tomcat no longer compiles with your patch applied. Looks like you missed adding a logger.

As far the loggers that are non-static, this is deliberate to allow per web-app logging without the messages getting mixed up so the TODOs should be removed from the patch.

Created attachment 24562
reworked patch

Rats! I'd forgotten that I had disabled compilation of tomcat-lite, as it won't compile for me.

The logger in tomcat-lite's SimpleSessionManager needs to be package protected rather than private.

I've also changed the TODOs to comments to say that the logs must not be made static.
creator: sebb@apache.org
